titles.title: Authorizing the printing of "History of the United States Capitol" as a House document.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Mica moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 358.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 402 - 1 (Roll no. 19).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/24/2004--Passed Senate without amendment. Orders the printing as a House document of a specified number of copies of the "History of the United States Capitol" by Glenn Brown, as prepared under the auspices of the Architect of the Capitol with support from the U.S. Capitol Preservation Commission and the U.S. Capitol Historical Society.
